intro: Pleurospermum camtschaticum, commonly known as the Caucasian tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
